channel.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
channel.description:
Some of you may have heard about this already, but i'll post what I already did on some other sites:
I have only just began looking into RS Server development... but comming from a background in coding (9 years worth) I've already seen that with the huge amounts of unorganized codes that are being put out, the servers have become somewhat... sloppy. The code itself is unnecessarily hard to follow.
I've been working for the past 2 days on a server code in C++ and have already got it working somewhat. The client and server exchange RSA keys, reads the login packet and checks the password. That's as far as I've gotten... but my plans are to make the server base engine, then release the APIs for making extensions. This way one could make extensions for it that they could load themselves in Perl, C, C++, or whatever (somewhat like Gaim).
I feel that this would provide an overall more stable server setup, since the base code would be rarely modified. What do you guys thing? Should I persue this further or would no one use it?
I am doing it in wxWidgets so the GUI and socket base would be portable from Linux to Windows and Mac.
And here's a screen shot if the progress: (Yes, I was running this on ReactOS to make sure the socket code was portable when I decided to screen shot this) [IMG]http://www.siliconwarfare.com/cppserver.png[/img]

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @Jaywalker Jaywalker
item.description:
@Jaywalker wrote:

Hehe, thanks Javacisnotrecognized. And Yes… i know I am a computer nerd… But I also know I get paid $20 per hour for programming And that’s before I’ve even been to college for it.

Update: The server now sends some character information to the client… no display yet though

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Pure Skill:

no a fense but u dudes are nerds[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 12:26:16 AM[/size][hr]no a fense but u dudes are nerds[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 12:26:57 AM[/size][hr]jaywalker wat dont u no are u one of those computer nerds that live on the computer?

And my retarded goldfish has a higher IQ and better grammar then you do.

As for this server, this is the most amazing thing I have seen. Ever. You keep this up man, you are a fucking genius.

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @Jaywalker Jaywalker
item.description:
@Jaywalker wrote:

You see, the server only handles incomming and outgoing packets. I’ve followed the entire connection stream and had it working already. The rest is just telling the client what to display… it has all of the information. So i won’t have to rewrite anything… The client will remain in java (unless someone is brave enough to attempt that… or use GCC’s java compiler to make it into an exe… but that’s rather buggy).

My goal is to have a decient working version within the month

Keep me posted with ideas.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Definatly persue this because C++ R0({$ and Java suc{$ because of limitations. People would use this just out of ease of an executable and not needing the JDK just to play the servers. I am not sure if it is possible considering all of the Deobs are all in Java and the main connection between a private server and the client is use Java, you would have to rewrite basicly everything. Good-luck with it!

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @Jaywalker Jaywalker
item.description:
@Jaywalker wrote:

Oh I just now began posting on this forum. I started paying attention on rs-server but it’s fairly… noobish from what I’ve seen. Everyone always bitches on there. I just started looking at rs private servers not long ago… The code is really simple… Just a bit sloppy at this point. Rep just means I haven’t done much here… But if you were ever into habbo, i was part of the Habbo Plus project with Trevo for quite some time

I know my way about things

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @dirk dirk
item.description:

how can u b so smart with 0 rep 1 week ago i didnt no what and IP was lol. now i know basic coding. LOLS. u shuld code some kool stuff with 9 YRS experince :S

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @Jaywalker Jaywalker
item.description:
@Jaywalker wrote:

Well, I’ve already got that planned. I need thoughts now… Lol.

My current suggestions are to either have a plugin system that works with the API that can be written in C,C++,Perl,Python, etc. || Have a set scripting language JUST FOR private servers.

I’m torn though… :-/

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on a new direction?
item.dc:creator: @guthan38 guthan38
item.description:
@guthan38 wrote:

u should pursue this
